constituent: vow, fold, finger, fingers, axe, say, words, keitai, mouth
koohiiStory1: This Japanese couple wrote the vows that they had made to each other onto a piece of paper and then folded it into an origami, and put it somewhere in their appartment. To everybody else it is an origami, but to them it is also a symbol of their vows. -- "the folded words are vows". Note : in this story and a few others I use the image of an origami for the primitive "fold".
koohiiStory2: A Japanese wedding tradition is to present each other with origami cranes with their vows written on the BOTTOM.
words: swear, vow, take an oath, pledge
